continueFromHere.commandError: Failed to send command to machine
continueFromHere.startError: Failed to start sending reversed G-code

errorModal.title: G-Code Error
errorModal.executionStoppedDescription: encountered an error while processing G-code and has stopped execution.

grblErrors.1: Expected command letter - A command letter was expected but not found
grblErrors.2: Bad number format - A number was expected but not found or has an invalid format
grblErrors.3: Invalid statement - A statement was not recognized or supported
grblErrors.4: Negative value - A negative value was provided where a positive value is required
grblErrors.5: Setting disabled - Homing cycle failure. Homing is not enabled via settings
grblErrors.6: Setting step pulse min - Minimum step pulse time must be greater than 3μsec
grblErrors.7: Setting read fail - An EEPROM read failed. Auto-restoring affected EEPROM to default values
grblErrors.8: Idle error - '$' command cannot be used unless is IDLE
grblErrors.9: System GC lock - G-code commands are locked out during alarm or jog state
grblErrors.10: Soft limit error - Soft limits cannot be enabled without homing also enabled
grblErrors.11: Overflow - Max characters per line exceeded. Received command line was not executed
grblErrors.12: Max step rate exceeded - '$' setting value cause the step rate to exceed the maximum supported
grblErrors.13: Check door - Safety door detected as opened and door state initiated
grblErrors.14: Line length exceeded - Build info or startup line exceeded EEPROM line length limit
grblErrors.15: Travel exceeded - Jog target exceeds machine travel. Jog command has been ignored
grblErrors.16: Invalid jog command - Jog command has no '=' or contains prohibited g-code
grblErrors.17: Setting disabled laser - Laser mode requires PWM output
grblErrors.19: Non positive value - Non-positive value received for an expected positive value
grblErrors.20: Unsupported command - Unsupported or invalid g-code command found in block
grblErrors.21: Modal group violation - More than one g-code command from same modal group found in block
grblErrors.22: Undefined feed rate - Feed rate has not yet been set or is undefined
grblErrors.23: Command value not integer - G-code command in block requires an integer value
grblErrors.24: Axis command conflict - More than one g-code command that requires axis words found in block
grblErrors.25: Word repeated - Repeated g-code word found in block
grblErrors.26: No axis words - No axis words found in block for g-code command or current modal state which requires them
grblErrors.27: Invalid line number - Line number value is invalid
grblErrors.28: Value word missing - G-code command is missing a required value word
grblErrors.29: Unsupported coord sys - G59.x work coordinate systems are not supported
grblErrors.30: G53 invalid motion mode - G53 only allowed with G0 and G1 motion modes
grblErrors.31: Axis words exist - Axis words found in block when no command or current modal state uses them
grblErrors.32: No axis words in plane - G2 and G3 arcs require at least one in-plane axis word
grblErrors.33: Invalid target - Motion command target is invalid
grblErrors.34: Arc radius error - Arc radius value is invalid
grblErrors.35: No offsets in plane - G2 and G3 arcs require at least one in-plane offset word
grblErrors.36: Unused words - Unused value words found in block
grblErrors.37: G43 dynamic axis error - G43.1 dynamic tool length offset is not assigned to configured tool length axis
grblErrors.38: Illegal tool table entry - Tool number greater than max supported value
grblErrors.39: Value out of range - G-code value is out of valid range
grblErrors.40: Tool change pending - Tool change is pending and must be completed before continuing
grblErrors.41: Spindle not running - Spindle must be running for this operation
grblErrors.42: Illegal plane - Selected plane is not valid for this operation
grblErrors.43: Max feed rate exceeded - Commanded feed rate exceeds maximum allowed
grblErrors.44: RPM out of range - Spindle RPM value is outside valid range
grblErrors.45: Limits engaged - Limit switches are currently engaged
grblErrors.46: Homing required - Homing cycle must be performed before operation
grblErrors.48: Value word conflict - Conflicting value words found in block
grblErrors.49: Self test failed - System self-test has failed
grblErrors.50: EStop - Emergency stop has been triggered
grblErrors.51: Motor fault - Motor driver fault detected
grblErrors.52: Setting value out of range - Setting value is outside valid range
grblErrors.53: Setting disabled - Requested setting is disabled
grblErrors.54: Invalid retract position - Tool retract position is invalid
grblErrors.55: Illegal homing configuration - Homing configuration is invalid
grblErrors.56: Coord system locked - Coordinate system is locked and cannot be modified
grblErrors.57: Unexpected demarcation - Unexpected character or demarcation found
grblErrors.60: SD mount error - SD card mounting failed
grblErrors.61: File read error - Error reading from file
grblErrors.62: Failed open dir - Failed to open directory
grblErrors.63: Dir not found - Directory not found
grblErrors.64: SD not mounted - SD card is not mounted
grblErrors.65: FS not mounted - File system is not mounted
grblErrors.66: FS read only - File system is read-only
grblErrors.70: BT init error - Bluetooth initialization failed
grblErrors.71: Expression unknown op - Unknown operator in expression
grblErrors.72: Expression divide by zero - Division by zero in expression
grblErrors.73: Expression argument out of range - Expression argument is out of range
grblErrors.74: Expression invalid argument - Invalid argument in expression
grblErrors.75: Expression syntax error - Syntax error in expression
grblErrors.76: Expression invalid result - Expression result is invalid
grblErrors.77: Authentication required - Authentication is required for this operation
grblErrors.78: Access denied - Access to resource is denied
grblErrors.79: Not allowed critical event - Operation not allowed during critical event
grblErrors.80: Flow control not executing macro - Flow control command not executing in macro
grblErrors.81: Flow control syntax error - Syntax error in flow control command
grblErrors.82: Flow control stack overflow - Flow control stack overflow
grblErrors.83: Flow control out of memory - Flow control ran out of memory
grblErrors.84: File open failed - Failed to open file

scene3d.canvasErrorMessage: The 3D canvas encountered an error and needs to be reloaded.
scene3d.reloadCanvasTooltip: Reload the 3D canvas if it's not working properly

previousButton.failedToStartReverse: Failed to start sending reversed G-code
previousButton.noGCodeLineSelectedOrExist: No G-code line selected or exist
previousButton.machineHoldRequired: Machine must be in Hold state (current: {{status}})

startButton.machineIdleRequired: Machine must be in Idle state (current: {{status}})

startOptionsModal.title: Start Options
startOptionsModal.executeAllFromFirst: Execute all G-code commands from the first line

stopButton.confirmContinue: Are you sure you want to continue? Make sure the door is closed.

connectionStatus.title: Connection Status
connectionStatus.description: This shows your current connection status to the CNC machine. You can connect via USB or Network.

scene3d.title: 3D Scene
scene3d.description: This is your main workspace where you can visualize your G-code toolpaths in 3D. Use mouse to rotate, zoom, and pan the view.

gcodeEditor.title: G-Code Editor
gcodeEditor.description: View and edit your G-code here. You can load files and see the current line being executed highlighted.

controlButtons.title: Control Buttons
controlButtons.description: These are your main machine control buttons: Start, Pause, Stop, and Reset your CNC operations.

jogControls.title: Jog Controls
jogControls.description: Use these controls to manually move your CNC machine axes. Adjust step size and move in precise increments.

continuousMode.title: Continuous Mode
continuousMode.description: When enabled, hold down jog buttons to move continuously. Release to stop. Perfect for fine positioning and manual control.

keyboardMode.title: Keyboard Mode
keyboardMode.description: Use arrow keys for X/Y movement, Page Up/Down for Z axis. Hold Shift + arrows for diagonal movement. The yellow ring indicates keyboard mode is active.

console.title: Console
console.description: Monitor machine responses and send manual G-code commands directly to your CNC machine.

statusDisplay.title: Status Display
statusDisplay.description: View real-time machine coordinates, work coordinates, and current machine state information.

relativeCoordinates.title: Relative Coordinates
relativeCoordinates.description: These blue values show your position relative to the current work coordinate system (G54-G59). This is your "working zero" - the reference point for your current job.
relativeCoordinates.editableNote: You can click on these blue values to edit them directly! This allows you to set precise coordinates for your work positioning.

absoluteCoordinates.title: Absolute Coordinates
absoluteCoordinates.description: These green values show your position in absolute machine coordinates. This is the true position relative to the machine's home position, regardless of work offsets.

homeButtons.title: Home Buttons
homeButtons.description: Use these green home buttons to return each axis to its home position. This is essential for machine calibration and safety.

zeroButtons.title: Zero Buttons
zeroButtons.description: Set the current position as zero for each axis. This establishes your work coordinate system for accurate positioning.

resetButtons.title: Reset Buttons
resetButtons.description: Reset temporary work offsets (G92) for each axis. Use this to clear any temporary coordinate adjustments.

calibrationModal.title: Calibrate {{axis}} Axis

stepDescriptions.first: Enter the first measurement to start calibration
stepDescriptions.jog: Move the machine to a new position
stepDescriptions.second: Enter the second measurement to complete calibration

first.step1: Place your measurement tool at the starting position
first.step3: Click Next to proceed to jogging

jog.step1: Use the jog controls to move the machine to a new position
jog.step2: Make sure to move at least 1mm from the starting position
jog.step3: Click Next when you've reached the desired position

second.step1: Place your measurement tool at the current position
second.step4: Click Complete Calibration to save the new steps/mm value

calibrationModal.holdButtonToJog: Hold button to jog, release to stop
calibrationModal.continuousModeTooltip: Toggle between step-by-step and continuous jogging modes

errors.invalidStepsCalculation: Invalid steps calculation. Please check your measurements.

alarmModal.title: Machine Alarm
alarmModal.alarmStateDescription: The machine is currently in an alarm state and requires attention before operation can continue.
alarmModal.unlockNote: Note: Unlocking will reset active modes and clear the alarm state.

alarmCodes.1: Hard limit triggered. Machine position is likely lost due to sudden and immediate halt. Re-homing is highly recommended.
alarmCodes.2: Soft limit alarm. G-code motion target exceeds machine travel. Machine position retained. Alarm may be unlocked.
alarmCodes.3: Reset while in motion. Machine position is likely lost due to sudden and immediate halt. Re-homing is highly recommended.
alarmCodes.4: Probe fail. Probe is not in the expected initial state before starting probe cycle when G38.2 and G38.3 is not triggered and G38.4 and G38.5 is triggered.
alarmCodes.5: Probe fail. Probe did not contact the workpiece within the programmed travel for G38.2 and G38.4.
alarmCodes.6: Homing fail. The active homing cycle was reset.
alarmCodes.7: Homing fail. Safety door was opened during homing cycle.
alarmCodes.8: Homing fail. Pull off travel failed to clear limit switch. Try increasing pull-off setting or check wiring.
alarmCodes.9: Homing fail. Could not find limit switch within search distances. Try increasing max travel, decreasing pull-off distance, or check wiring.
alarmCodes.10: Homing fail. Could not find limit switch within search distances. Try increasing max travel, decreasing pull-off distance, or check wiring.
alarmCodes.11: Homing fail. Homing not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.12: Homing fail. Second dual axis limit switch failed to trigger within configured search distance after first.
alarmCodes.13: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.14: Spindle at speed timeout. Either the spindle hasnt gotten up to speed in the timeframe set for spindle at speed or spindle has been wired incorrectly to your controller.
alarmCodes.15: Homing fail. Could not find second limit switch for auto squared axis within search distances. Try increasing max travel, decreasing pull-off distance, or check wiring.
alarmCodes.16: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.17: Motor fault. Issue encountered with closed loop motor tracking. Position likely lost.
alarmCodes.18: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.19: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.20: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.21: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.22: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.23: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.24: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.25: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.26: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.27: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.28: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.29: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.30: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.31: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.32: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.33: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.34: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.35: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.36: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.37: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.38: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.39: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
alarmCodes.40: Homing fail. Homing cycle not enabled in settings.
